item.title: 谷歌正在研发推理人工智能，追赶 OpenAI 的脚步
item.description:
这一举措加深了搜索巨头与 OpenAI 的竞争

。【原文：

The push deepens the search giant’s rivalry with OpenAI

item.title: 金丝雀码头利用零售资产为 3.5 亿英镑债券再融资
item.description: 金丝雀码头集团首席执行官肖比-汗（Shobi Khan）表示，该集团希望以其零售资产为后盾筹集新的债务，以偿还 4 月份到期的 3.5 亿英镑（4.65 亿美元）债券。【原文：Canary Wharf Group is hoping to raise new debt backed by its retail assets in order to repay £350 million ($465 million) of bonds maturing in April, according to its Chief Executive Officer, Shobi Khan.】

item.title: 石油流量连续第四个月下滑，这次是因为利比亚
item.description: 由于利比亚的政治风波导致供应中断，石油海运量在 9 月份连续第四个月下降。【原文：The seaborne flow of oil fell for a fourth straight month in September on the back of hefty declines from Libya, where a political row spilled over into supply disruptions.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚要求已经挑衅的债券持有人减息 18
item.description: 埃塞俄比亚建议其 10 亿美元债券的持有者在债务重组中承担 18% 的损失，尽管它承认一个有影响力的投资者团体已事先拒绝了这一提议。【原文：Ethiopia proposed that holders of its $1 billion bond take an 18% loss in a debt restructuring, even as it acknowledged that an influential group of investors has rejected such an offer in advance.】

item.title: 经济形势好转，南非首席执行官看到 "绿芽
item.description: 南非最大的两家金融服务公司的首席执行官表示，自联合政府成立以来，人们对南非的看法有所改善，但南非仍需警惕自满情绪。【原文：Sentiment about South Africa has improved since the formation of a coalition government but the nation needs to be cautious about complacency, according to chief executive officers at two of the nation’s biggest financial-services companies.】

item.title: 南非财政部支持银行家担任非洲开发银行下一任首席执行官
item.description: 南非国库支持非洲开发银行前高级职员巴加布利-斯瓦兹-查巴拉拉（Bajabulile Swazi Tshabalala）成为泛非贷款机构的下一任负责人。【原文：South Africa’s National Treasury endorsed Bajabulile Swazi Tshabalala, a former senior staffer at the African Development Bank, to become the next head of the pan-African lender.】

item.title: 大举押注中国的对冲基金 9 月份收益率超过 25
item.description: 据知情人士透露，随着中国股市飙升，中国的刺激政策在 9 月份给一些对冲基金带来了超过 25% 的回报。【原文：China’s stimulus blitz handed more than 25% returns in September to some hedge funds as the nation’s stocks surged, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。中东紧张局势加剧，石油连续第二天反弹。耐克撤回了其业绩指导后，耐克股价将下跌，而 KKR 正在权衡对一家亚洲芯片制造商的收购要约。以下是市场动态。【原文：Good morning. Oil is rallying for a second day as Middle East tensions mount. US stocks are poised for a muted open following yesterday’s flight to safety, Nike shares are set to fall after the firm withdrew its guidance and KKR is weighing a takeover bid for an Asian chipmaker. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Morwenna Coniam】

item.title: 欧洲关税投票在即，Xpeng 探索本地化方案
item.description: 中国汽车制造商新鹏公司（Xpeng Inc.【原文：Chinese automaker Xpeng Inc. is looking at several options in Europe that may help it to localize production and sidestep tariffs the bloc is levying on electric vehicles made in Asia’s biggest economy.】

item.title: 价值 140 亿欧元的德国铁路股份出售案面临决定性投票
item.description: 德国铁路股份公司（Deutsche Bahn AG）计划以 143 亿欧元（158 亿美元）出售其物流部门，该计划将于周三面临决定性投票。【原文：Deutsche Bahn AG’s planned €14.3 billion ($15.8 billion) sale of its logistics arm is facing a decisive vote Wednesday.】

item.title: 食品价格上涨导致加纳 9 月通胀升温
item.description: 加纳的通货膨胀率在 9 月份出人意料地上升，这是 6 个月以来的首次上升，使人们对决策者关于价格增长将在年底进一步放缓的预测产生怀疑。【原文：Ghana’s inflation rate unexpectedly increased in September for the first time in six months, raising doubts about policymakers’ forecasts that price growth will ease further toward the end of the years.】

item.title: 以色列誓言报复伊朗，意大利召集七国集团会议
item.description: 在中东紧张局势不断恶化之际，意大利召集了七国集团领导人周三特别会议。【原文：Italy has called an extraordinary Group of Seven leaders meeting Wednesday amid worsening tensions in the Middle East.】

item.title: Telegram 首席执行官称服务条款更新后变化不大
item.description: 消息应用 Telegram 首席执行官帕维尔-杜罗夫（Pavel Durov）表示，Telegram 最近宣布的服务条款更新并没有带来太多变化。【原文：Messaging app Telegram’s recently announced updates to its terms of service haven’t led to many changes, according to Chief Executive Officer Pavel Durov.】

item.title: 斯特林银行因 "令人震惊的松懈 "风险检查被罚款 2,900 万英镑
item.description: Starling 银行被罚款 2,900 万英镑（3,850 万美元），监管机构称其对高风险客户的控制 "松懈得令人震惊"。【原文：Starling Bank was fined £29 million ($38.5 million) for what regulators described as “shockingly lax” controls around risky customers.】

item.title: 毕马威表示，加拿大首席执行官对经济增长的担忧与日俱增
item.description: 毕马威会计师事务所委托进行的一项调查显示，加拿大的首席执行官们越来越担心国内经济，尽管大多数人仍然看好自己公司未来几年的前景。【原文：Chief executive officers in Canada are getting more concerned about the domestic economy, though most are still bullish on their own companies’ prospects over the next few years, according to a survey commissioned by KPMG.】

item.title: 香港经纪人被 "百年一遇 "的股票狂潮淹没
item.description: 香港的股票经纪人正在经历他们职业生涯中最繁忙的时期之一，一位从业 31 年的资深经纪人将香港的突然反弹形容为 "百年一遇 "的事件。【原文：Stock brokers in Hong Kong are having one of the busiest periods in their career, with a 31-year veteran describing the city’s sudden rally as a “once in a century” event.】

item.title: 人工智能初创公司估值达 5 亿美元，可与呼叫中心抗衡
item.description: 一群经验丰富的硅谷高管为一家提供人工智能增强型联络中心服务的新创公司筹集了 5000 万美元的资金，加入了寻求颠覆传统外包服务的众多公司的行列。【原文：A group of seasoned Silicon Valley executives raised $50 million for a new startup that provides artificial intelligence-enhanced contact center services, joining a crowded field of companies looking to upend traditional outsourcing.】

item.title: DirecTV 首席执行官在付费电视大合并中看到了卫星之外的未来
item.description: DirecTV 拟收购竞争对手 Dish，这表明卫星电视业务正在衰落。首席执行官比尔-莫罗（Bill Morrow）对下一步的发展有很大的想法。【原文：DirecTV’s proposed takeover of rival Dish is an admission that the satellite-TV business is fading. Chief Executive Officer Bill Morrow has big ideas about what could come next.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行分析师称，特朗普大选获胜可能利好美股
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行资本市场（RBC Capital Markets）的一项分析师调查显示，唐纳德-特朗普领导的共和党在大选中大获全胜可能是最看好美股的结果，其中能源和金融板块受益最大。【原文：A sweep for Donald Trump’s Republican party in elections is likely to be the most bullish outcome for US stocks, with the energy and financial sectors benefiting the most, according to a survey of analysts at RBC Capital Markets.】

item.title: 印度中央银行小组批准修改 MIBOR 和新基准
item.description: 印度储备银行成立的一个小组建议修改孟买银行同业拆放利率（MIBOR）的计算方法，并建议为隔夜货币市场引入新的基准。【原文：A panel set up by the Reserve Bank of India recommended changes to the methodology for the Mumbai Interbank Outright Rate, or MIBOR, and suggested introducing new benchmarks for the overnight money market.】

item.title: 中国乐观情绪抵消地缘政治风险，新兴股市大涨
item.description: 发展中国家股市周三攀升，中国股市受刺激因素推动，抵消了中东冲突进一步升级的风险。【原文：Developing world stocks climbed on Wednesday, with stimulus-driven China shares offsetting risks over further escalation of conflict in the Middle East.】

item.title: 印度 CCI 批准 Mankind Pharma 收购疫苗制造商
item.description: 印度竞争委员会发布消息称，印度反垄断监管机构批准了 Mankind Pharma Ltd. 以 1,363 亿卢比（16 亿美元）收购疫苗生产商 Bharat Serums and Vaccines Ltd. 的交易。【原文：India’s anti-trust regulator approved Mankind Pharma Ltd.’s 136.3 billion rupees ($1.6 billion) acquisition of vaccine-maker Bharat Serums and Vaccines Ltd., according to a release by the Competition Commission of India.】

item.title: 英国金融公司对地缘政治的担忧达到创纪录水平
item.description: 英国央行称，英国金融服务公司中担心地缘政治风险的比例达到了自2008年金融危机以来的最高水平。【原文：The share of UK financial services firms worried about geopolitical risks is at its highest level since the 2008 crash, the Bank of England said.】

item.title: 非洲顶级基金管理公司 PIC 资产增长 3.6%，达 1,550 亿美元
item.description: 在南非经济增长乏力的情况下，非洲最大的基金管理公司称其管理的资产攀升了 3.6%。【原文：Africa’s largest fund manager said assets under management climbed 3.6% after amid muted economic growth in South Africa.】

item.title: 肯尼亚证券交易所所长认为动荡后的反弹将带来更多资金流入
item.description: 肯尼亚证券交易所负责人表示，肯尼亚股票市场从近期政治动荡引发的下跌中反弹后，将吸引更多投资者的兴趣。【原文：Kenya’s equity market is set to attract more interest from investors after rebounding from the fall triggered by recent political upheaval, according to the head of the country’s stock exchange.】

item.title: 欧洲央行 10 月降息势不可挡
item.description: 三周前，欧洲央行官员还认为不太可能降息，现在看来，当他们在 10 月 17 日制定下一个政策时，降息几成定局。【原文：An interest-rate cut that European Central Bank officials deemed unlikely just three weeks ago now seems a near certainty when they next set policy on Oct. 17.】

item.title: 科威特和巴林在燃料贸易方面追随海湾地区较大的邻国
item.description: 科威特和巴林正在建立石油贸易部门，试图利用最近炼油厂的扩建来套现，并效仿该地区一些最大的生产国在买卖燃料方面取得的成功。【原文：Kuwait and Bahrain are setting up oil trading arms as they seek to cash in on recent refinery expansions and emulate the success of some of the region’s biggest producers in buying and selling fuels.】

item.title: 美国银行的门萨表示利率不会回到大流行前的水平
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的伯纳德-门萨（Bernard Mensah）说，由于从地缘政治冲突到供应链变化等各种摩擦困扰着全球经济，世界许多地区的利率可能会持续走高。【原文：Interest rates in many parts of the world will probably stay elevated as frictions ranging from geopolitical conflicts to changes in supply chains plague the global economy, said Bank of America Corp.’s Bernard Mensah said.】

item.title: 韩国锌业与贝恩联手回购高于 MBK 出价的股票
item.description: 韩国锌业公司（Korea Zinc Co.）正在抵御一家私募股权公司主动提出的控制权收购要约，该公司已邀请贝恩资本（Bain Capital）回购这家在首尔上市的公司最多 18% 的流通股。【原文：Korea Zinc Co., which is fending off an unsolicited bid for control from a private equity firm, has roped in Bain Capital to buy back up to 18% outstanding shares of the Seoul-listed company.】

item.title: 达里奥与阿布扎比皇室的 G42 据说将搁置投资合资企业
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，雷-达里奥（Ray Dalio）的家族办公室和谢赫-塔赫农-本-扎耶德-阿勒纳哈扬（Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan）的人工智能公司 G42 已放弃在阿布扎比共同成立一家资产管理企业的计划。【原文：Ray Dalio’s family office and Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan’s artificial intelligence firm G42 have abandoned plans to set up an asset management venture together in Abu Dhabi, according to people familiar with the matter.】
